required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Split-face Tolerability Comparison Between Adapalene-Benzoyl Peroxide Gel Versus Tretinoin Gel
clinical_study.official_title: Split-face Tolerability Comparison Between Epiduo速 (Adapalene and Benzoyl Peroxide) Gel 0.1%/2.5% Versus Retin-A Micro速 (Tretinoin Gel) Microsphere, 0.1% in Subjects With Acne Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the tolerability of Epiduo速 (adapalene and benzoyl peroxide) Gel 0.1%/2.5% to Retin-A Micro速 (tretinoin gel) microsphere when used by subjects with acne vulgaris for 3 weeks in terms of local tolerability parameters (erythema, dryness, scaling, stinging/burning) and preference.

detailed_description.textblock: Adult subjects with acne vulgaris will receive tretinoin gel 0.1% on one side of the face and adapalene 0.1% / benzoyl peroxide 2.5% gel on the other side of the face once daily for a period 3 weeks (22 days). Tolerability assessments (erythema, dryness, scaling, stinging/burning)on both sides of the face will be taken on each visit, on each weekday from from baseline to day 22. The investigator and subjects will respond to user preference questions on days 5, 12, 19, and 22.

primary_outcome.description: Worst postbaseline tolerability assessment for erythema.
Worst postbaseline tolerability assessments for dryness.
Worst postbaseline tolerability assessments for stinging/burning

secondary_outcome.description: Tolerability assessments at day 22 for erythema
Tolerability assessments at day 22 for dryness
Tolerability assessments at day 22 for scaling
Tolerability assessments at day 22 for stinging/burning

Cumulative tolerability assessments for erythema. Cumulative tolerability is defined as the sum of the tolerability scores for erythema. Tolerability was assessed on a 4-point categorical scale(0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe) for all subjects at each visit.

Cumulative tolerability assessments for scaling. Cumulative tolerability is defined as the sum of the tolerability scores for scaling. Tolerability was assessed on a 4-point categorical scale(0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe) for all subjects at each visit.

Cumulative tolerability assessments for dryness. Cumulative tolerability is defined as the sum of the tolerability scores for dryness. Tolerability was assessed on a 4-point categorical scale(0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe) for all subjects at each visit.

Cumulative tolerability assessments for stinging/burning. Cumulative tolerability is defined as the sum of the tolerability scores stinging/burning. Tolerability was assessed on a 4-point categorical scale(0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe) for all subjects at each visit.

Cumulative tolerability assessments for erythema, scaling, dryness, and stinging/burning. Cumulative tolerability is defined as the sum of the tolerability scores for erythema, scaling, dryness, or stinging/burning. Tolerability was assessed on a 4-point categorical scale(0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe) for all subjects at each visit.

other_outcome.description: Response from investigator when asked: "Which side of the face appears to be less irritated?" Data collected from available participants.
Response from subjects when asked: "Which side of the face feels less irritated?" Data collected from available participants on each assessment day.
Overall tolerability preference survey taken by the subjects. Data collected from available subjects on day 22.

intervention.description: Once-daily application of fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% in an aqueous based gel.
Once-daily application of tretinoin gel, 0.1% by weight, in a formulation of porous microspheres in an aqueous gel.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects of any race
- Subjects 18 years or older
- Subjects with acne vulgaris
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with an allergy to a component of the study drugs (refer to the package inserts for Epiduo Gel and Retin-A Micro 0.1%)
- Subjects with a washout period for topical treatment (less than 1 week for corticosteroids or 4 weeks for retinoids)
- Subjects with a washout period for systemic treatment (less than 1 week for medications that may have increased photosensitivity or 4 weeks for corticosteroids or 24 weeks for oral retinoids)
- Subjects with a sunburn, eczema, atopic dermatitis, perioral dermatitis, rosacea, or other topical conditions on the treatment area
- Subjects with planned unprotected and intense UV exposure during the study (mountain sports, UV radiation, sunbathing, etc)

class.title: ____ left smaller amount of residue on skin (n=71)

outcome.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type Worst Postbaseline Tolerability Assessment (Erythema)
outcome.description: Worst Postbaseline Tolerability Assessment Grouped by Fitzpatrick Skin Type for Erythema. Fitzpatrick skin type is a numerical classification scale for the color of skin from Type 1 to Type VI. Skin type 1 = always burns and never tans (light, pale skin) and skin type VI = never burns, tans very easily, and is deeply pigmented (black, very dark brown to black skin).

outcome.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type User Preference Survey at Day 22
outcome.description: User Preference Survey at Day 22 (Safety Population) Grouped by Fitzpatrick Skin Type. Fitzpatrick skin type (FST) is a numerical classification scale for the color of skin from Type 1 to Type VI. Skin type 1 = always burns and never tans (light, pale skin) and skin type VI = never burns, tans very easily, and is deeply pigmented (black, very dark brown to black skin). Two subjects did not participate in the User Preference Survey; as a result, 2 subjects were not included in the FST I - III group results below.

Skin type 1 = always burns and never tans (light, pale skin) and skin type VI = never burns, tans very easily, and is deeply pigmented (black, very dark brown to black skin). Two subjects did not participate in the User Preference Survey; as a result, 2 subjects were not included in the FST I - III group results below.

outcome.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type Overall Tolerability Preference Survey Results
outcome.description: Overall Tolerability Preference Survey Results at Day 22 (Safety Population) Grouped by Fitzpatrick Skin Type (FST). Data collected from available subjects on day 22. Fitzpatrick skin type is a numerical classification scale for the color of skin from Type 1 to Type VI. Skin type 1 = always burns and never tans (light, pale skin) and skin type VI = never burns, tans very easily, and is deeply pigmented (black, very dark brown to black skin). One subject did not participate in the User Preference Survey; as a result, 1 subject was not included in the FST I - III group results below.

group.title: Epiduo Gel (Fitzpatrick Skin Types I-III)
group.description: Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% gel Epiduo Gel : Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% in an aqueous based gel.

group.title: Retin-A Micro (Fitzpatrick Skin Types I-III)
group.description: Tretinoin gel, 0.1% Retin-A Micro Microsphere 0.1% : Tretinoin gel, 0.1% by weight, in a formulation of porous microspheres in an aqueous gel.

group.title: Epiduo Gel (Fitzpatrick Skin Types IV-VI)
group.description: Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% gel Epiduo Gel : Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% in an aqueous based gel.

group.title: Retin-A Micro (Fitzpatrick Skin Types IV-VI)
group.description: Tretinoin gel, 0.1% Retin-A Micro Microsphere 0.1% : Tretinoin gel, 0.1% by weight, in a formulation of porous microspheres in an aqueous gel.

measure.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type Overall Tolerability Preference Survey Results
measure.description: Overall Tolerability Preference Survey Results at Day 22 (Safety Population) Grouped by Fitzpatrick Skin Type (FST). Data collected from available subjects on day 22. Fitzpatrick skin type is a numerical classification scale for the color of skin from Type 1 to Type VI. Skin type 1 = always burns and never tans (light, pale skin) and skin type VI = never burns, tans very easily, and is deeply pigmented (black, very dark brown to black skin). One subject did not participate in the User Preference Survey; as a result, 1 subject was not included in the FST I - III group results below.

group.title: Epiduo Gel
group.description: Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% gel Epiduo Gel : Fixed dose of adapalene 0.1% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% in an aqueous based gel.

group.title: Retin-A Micro Microsphere 0.1%
group.description: Tretinoin gel, 0.1% Retin-A Micro Microsphere 0.1% : Tretinoin gel, 0.1% by weight, in a formulation of porous microspheres in an aqueous gel.

group.title: Non-application Site
group.description: Adverse events occurring on non-application sites

event.description: Epileptic seizure not related to study medicines.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
